"Secret variable" object type
To properly store non-disclosure data, the System has a special
system type
called the
"Secret variable"
[
SYS_SECRET_VARIABLE
]. It allows the System to store passwords to external databases, user signatures, etc.
To configure a secret variable, the user needs to create a new instance in the registry of the "Secret Variable" type by clicking the
button (see more about working with registries
here
).
Setting up
In the opened window, fill in the following parameters:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering a unique setting name.
Identifier
Entering a type instance identifier.
Value
Entering value that should be hidden.
The data display mode is configured by clicking the
/
icon above the field:
– show value;
– hide value.
By default, the value is hidden.
Encryption  required
A boolean attribute that determines the use of value encryption.
After selecting the "Yes" value, the specified variable is saved in encrypted form. The data will be displayed in encrypted form in subsequent views.
If the attribute value is empty or if "No" is selected, the variable is displayed without encryption.
When using the value in algorithms with the
secretVariable
function, the initial variable is taken into account without encryption.
By default, the value is stored in encrypted form.
The
value
of this attribute is characterized by the following features:
not fixed by the
audit
Systems;
the
value
of the variable is not transferred during
System update
via GUF files. The value of the secret variable must be specified manually on the updated instance;
the value is accessed inside the algorithm using the
secretVariable
function;
when accessing a variable, this value is considered as a password;
data is stored in the application cache, available for cache type invalidation.
The variable can be used as a
global value
(more commonly used in algorithms) that can only be changed by the System administrator.
Storage locations
The System supports the following options for storing secret variables:
For applications running on a single node:
on disk in the
config/secret_variable.csv
file;
in HashiCorp Vault storage (find more about configuring the secret storage in Vault
here
);
in the main database (find more about configuring the secret storage in the database
here
).
For applications running on multiple nodes:
in HashiCorp Vault storage (find more about configuring the secret storage in Vault
here
) – recommended option;
in an NFS network file system;
in the main database (find more about configuring the secret storage in the database
here
).
Use case
The secret variable can be used when generating the
ETL process
, where the same type of connection to various databases is configured. In other words, the address for connecting to the database may change during operation. In this case, the database URL for connection is set by the secret variable.
The algorithm returns the URL (as the global value) required during connection.
If the database URL is changed, it is enough to set a new value in an instance of the "Secret variable" type once without editing algorithms.
